item.title: Summer 2025 reading from MIT
item.description: MIT faculty and staff have published a variety of books in the past year, covering topics ranging from science and technology to culture, humanities, and social sciences. Some notable titles include a book on the history of infectious diseases, a guide to health care analytics, and a blueprint for harnessing AI for societal good. Other works explore themes like retirement, innovation, and the ethical promise of minority presence, showcasing the diverse intellectual contributions from the MIT community.
